result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie G Sears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) keep in compliance with the sex offender registry law; 4) comply with sex offender treatment or programs.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Jessie G Sears in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.    Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction with Huber for actual work and 11 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18  months.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Jessie G Sears in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion of Justice Point report that was filed with the Court on today's date. Negotiations placed on the record.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The Court informed the parties that the Court at sentencing will listen to one oral statement by a friend or relative, and that all other statements must be submitted to the Court in writing at least 72 hours before the scheduled sentencing date. 

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jessie G Sears in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joshua Miles Mathy for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Jessie G Sears in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Jessie G Sears in custody.  Ronald Dague for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/13/15.

Case called due to violation report.    
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 

*** Court makes findings that there is no possible victim identified therefore recompense is not an issue/.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jessie G Sears in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Jessie G Sears in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
